pkgmetadata.longdescription: # A wrapper API of VIES VAT web service## CompatibilityRequires Python 2.7 or greater.Has been tested on 2.7, 3.4 and 3.6## Installation $ pip install pyvieser## Usage##### Python API:```pythonfrom pyVies import apitry: vies = api.Vies() result = vies.request('RO2785503', 'RO', extended_info=True) # works as well # result = vies.request('RO2785503') # result = vies.request('RO2785503', 'RO')except api.ViesValidationError as e: print (e)except api.ViesHTTPError as e: print (e)except api.ViesError as e: print (e)else: print (result) print (result.vatNumber) print(result.valid)# You may also use clean to extract vat number and country code# The line bellow would print ('2785503', 'RO')print (vies.clean('RO2785503'))```##### From console:$ pyvies <vat_number>The number should start with the country code.For python3 you might have to set python encoding for your environment (e.g. export PYTHONIOENCODING=utf-8).
